threat_description: Sabotage in the telecommunication industry is characterized by intentional disruption of services, equipment damage, and unauthorized access to critical infrastructure. It is seen that these malicious activities lead to significant service outages, financial losses, and compromised data security. The reliable functioning of communication networks is jeopardized when such intrusions occur, impacting both businesses and consumers alike.

threat_description: Intercepting communication in the telecommunications industry poses significant risks, including unauthorized access to sensitive information, disruption of services, and potential financial losses. Attackers can exploit vulnerabilities in network protocols or leverage sophisticated tools to eavesdrop on conversations, intercept data transmissions, and manipulate messages. Effective countermeasures, such as end-to-end encryption, secure authentication mechanisms, and continuous monitoring, are essential to mitigate these threats and protect communication integrity.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unauthorized access to GPS data can expose sensitive location information, compromising user privacy and security.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-384: Session Fixation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: GPS data can be compromised if session IDs are improperly managed, allowing attackers to hijack active sessions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-920: Improper Restriction of Power Consumption
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: GPS devices can be manipulated by attackers to drain power excessively, affecting device availability and reliability.

components.name: Signaling System No. 7 (SS7) and Diameter Protocols
components.description: Signaling System No. 7 (SS7) and Diameter (used in 4G and 5G networks)

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-287: Improper Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SS7 and Diameter protocols can be exploited if authentication mechanisms are weak, allowing unauthorized access to network functions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-300: Channel Accessible by Non-Endpoint
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SS7 and Diameter protocols often expose communication channels, allowing unauthorized interception and manipulation of network traffic.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive data in SS7 and Diameter Protocols can be intercepted if encryption is not implemented.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-350: Reliance on Reverse DNS Resolution for a Security-Critical Action
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SS7 and Diameter Protocols can be exploited if reverse DNS lookups are trusted for security validation.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-384: Session Fixation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Session fixation can allow unauthorized control over signaling sessions within SS7 and Diameter protocols, compromising communication security.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-472: External Control of Assumed-Immutable Web Parameter
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SS7 and Diameter protocols often use web-based management portals; manipulation of assumed-immutable parameters can enable unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site (Open Redirect)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SS7 and Diameter protocols can be manipulated to redirect signaling traffic, leading to potential security breaches.

components.name: Home Location Register (HLR)/ Home Subscriber Server (HSS)
components.description: Central database managing subscriber information and authentication.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1299: Missing Protection Mechanism for Alternate Hardware Interface
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: The HLR/HSS can be exposed to unauthorized access if alternate hardware interfaces are not properly protected.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: HLR/HSS systems store subscriber data which, if inadequately protected, can be accessed by unauthorized actors.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-287: Improper Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unauthorized access to subscriber data can occur if the HLR/HSS fails to verify identities correctly.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-798: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: In HLR/HSS systems, hard-coded credentials can be exploited to gain unauthorized access to subscriber information.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-284: Improper Access Control
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unauthorized access to sensitive subscriber data can occur if access controls in HLR/HSS are not properly enforced.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-795: Only Filtering Special Elements at a Specified Location
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improperly filtered input within HLR/HSS can enable attackers to inject malicious elements, compromising sensitive subscriber information.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unencrypted transmission of subscriber data can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive information stored in HLR/HSS.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-326: Inadequate Encryption Strength
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive subscriber data can be exposed if weak encryption is used in HLR/HSS communications.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Data between HLR/HSS and other network components can be intercepted if transmitted without encryption.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive subscriber information can be exposed if access controls in HLR/HSS are inadequately enforced.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-384: Session Fixation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Session fixation could allow unauthorized control over user sessions, compromising HLR/HSS and sensitive subscriber information.

components.name: Smartphones and Tablets
components.description: Mobile devices with internet connectivity, touchscreens, and app ecosystems.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Smartphone and tablet applications often mishandle sensitive data, which can be accessed by unauthorized users.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive data on smartphones and tablets can be intercepted during transmission if encryption is missing.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-749: Exposed Dangerous Method or Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Smartphone apps might expose risky methods, enabling attackers to exploit vulnerabilities and compromise the device.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-287: Improper Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Smartphones and tablets may permit unauthorized access if user authentication mechanisms are inadequately implemented.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-326: Inadequate Encryption Strength
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Smartphones and tablets may transmit sensitive data using weak encryption, risking interception by attackers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-352: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Mobile browsers on smartphones and tablets are susceptible to unauthorized actions via forged requests targeting authenticated sessions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-384: Session Fixation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Mobile apps may allow attackers to hijack active sessions, compromising account integrity and user data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Smartphones and Tablets often store credentials insecurely, allowing unauthorized access if device gets compromised.

threat_description: Threat actors in the telecommunications industry may create fraudulent billing or payment portals to deceive customers into providing sensitive information such as credit card details, personal identification, and login credentials. These malicious portals can mimic legitimate company websites, leading to financial losses, identity theft, and compromised customer trust. Ensuring robust security measures and educating consumers about spotting such frauds are critical in mitigating this threat.

components.name: Providers website
components.description: Telecommunication portal for managing services and customer information

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Providers' websites may inadvertently expose sensitive customer data due to improper access controls.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-287: Improper Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: The provider's website can be accessed without proper verification, potentially allowing unauthorized users to gain control.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-352: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive actions on providers' websites could be performed by attackers without user consent through forged requests.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-291: Reliance on IP Address for Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authentication based solely on IP addresses can be bypassed through IP spoofing, compromising the provider's website.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive data can be intercepted if transmitted without encryption on the provider's website.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Providers' website can be exploited to make unauthorized requests to internal services, bypassing firewall protections.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-326: Inadequate Encryption Strength
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: The website's encryption can be easily broken, exposing sensitive user data to potential attackers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-384: Session Fixation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: User sessions on providers' websites can be hijacked if session identifiers are not properly regenerated after login.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (Cross-site Scripting)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: User inputs on providers' websites can be improperly sanitized, allowing the execution of malicious scripts.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-350: Reliance on Reverse DNS Resolution for a Security-Critical Action
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Providers' website access may be wrongly granted based on potentially spoofed reverse DNS lookups.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-400: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: The providers website may become unresponsive if excessive resource requests are not properly limited.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-416: Use After Free
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Memory mismanagement can be exploited to execute arbitrary code on the provider's website, leading to data breaches.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site (Open Redirect)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: The provider's website can redirect users to malicious sites, leading to phishing or malware distribution.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command (SQL Injection)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Compromising the provider's website via SQL injection can expose sensitive customer and operational data.

components.name: Spoofed social media page
components.description: Counterfeit social media profile mimicking legitimate accounts.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1007: Insufficient Visual Distinction of Homoglyphs Presented to User
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Spoofed social media pages exploit visual similarities, making it difficult for users to distinguish between authentic and fake.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1022: Use of Web Link to Untrusted Target with window.opener Access
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Spoofed social media pages can exploit window.opener to hijack sessions or steal sensitive information.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Users' sensitive information can be exposed if attackers impersonate a legitimate social media page.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (Cross-site Scripting)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Spoofed social media pages may embed malicious scripts, compromising user data and session integrity.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-290: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Users can be tricked into divulging credentials if the spoofed social media page mimics the legitimate login interface.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-302: Authentication Bypass by Assumed-Immutable Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Spoofed social media pages can be exploited if authentication data is assumed immutable and bypassed by attackers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-345: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Fraudulent social media pages can mislead users when data authenticity is not sufficiently verified.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-451: User Interface (UI) Misrepresentation of Critical Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Critical information can be misrepresented on spoofed social media pages, deceiving users with false visual cues.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site (Open Redirect)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Users can be redirected to spoofed social media pages, increasing the likelihood of successful phishing attacks.

threat_description: Malware can disrupt services, intercept sensitive data, or grant unauthorized access to cybercriminals. By exploiting vulnerabilities in telecom systems, the threat actors aim to compromise network integrity, affect millions of users, and potentially cause severe financial and operational damage to organizations within the industry.

components.name: Office network
components.description: Corporate office network with workstations, servers, and printers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unsecured network configurations might expose confidential office data to unauthorized access and potential misuse.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-287: Improper Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Access to the office network can be easily gained if authentication mechanisms are inadequately implemented.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-290: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Office networks often rely on authentication methods that can be spoofed, leading to unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-309: Use of Password System for Primary Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Office networks often use password-based authentication, making them vulnerable to credential theft and unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Office networks can transmit sensitive data unencrypted, making it vulnerable to interception and unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-326: Inadequate Encryption Strength
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Office networks often use encrypted communication channels. Weak encryption can be exploited to intercept sensitive data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-384: Session Fixation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Office networks often have web-based administrative portals where session fixation attacks can compromise user accounts.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-400: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Office networks can experience service disruptions if resource consumption isn't effectively managed, leading to potential Denial of Service.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-502: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Office network applications often deserialize data for communication, making them vulnerable to malicious payload injection.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (Cross-site Scripting)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Internal web applications are susceptible to script injection, compromising both user data and network security.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improperly restricted UI layers could expose sensitive customer information within the CRM to unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unauthorized users can gain access to sensitive customer data through alternative authentication paths, compromising CRM security.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: CRM systems can be compromised if weak authentication mechanisms are exploited, granting unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive customer data in CRM systems can be exposed to unauthorized actors through improper access controls.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Credentials stored or transmitted without adequate protection can compromise CRM systems, exposing sensitive customer data.

cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unauthorized access to customer data can occur if access controls are not properly enforced within the CRM.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive customer data in CRM systems can be exposed if not encrypted during transmission or storage.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-326: Inadequate Encryption Strength

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (Cross-site Scripting)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: User data inputs in CRM systems can be manipulated to inject malicious scripts, compromising customer information security.
